sections.heading: Filing Form 8: LLP Statement of Accounts and Solvency (MCA)
content: You can fill in Form 8 online and stay in line with LLP rules. Stay out of trouble with the law and avoid fines.
Every year, all Limited Liability Partnerships (LLPs) in India must file Form 8 with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA). This is where they send their Statement of Accounts and Solvency.
Compliance experts will help you file your Form 8 quickly and correctly.

sections.heading: What does it mean to file Form 8?
content: Under Section 34 of the LLP Act, 2008, Form 8 is the Annual Return for LLP financials. It has:

points: The LLP's financial statements
Certification of solvency by chosen partners
Confirmation of compliance with the LLP agreement
Filing Form 8 keeps your LLP legal and open to the public.

sections.heading: Who Needs to Fill Out Form 8?

points: All Limited Liability Partnerships (LLPs) that are registered in India
LLPs that are currently active or inactive
LLPs that don't make any money or have no turnover
Form 8 must be filed every year, even if the LLP is not active.

sections.heading: When is Form 8 due?
content: 30 days after the end of the 6-month financial year
Example: If the fiscal year ends on March 31, Form 8 is due by October 30.
Filing late will cost you a lot of money in MCA fines.

points: ₹100 late fee every day (no limit)
LLP and its partners could be sued
MCA marked LLP as not in compliance
It's very important to file Form 8 on time to avoid fines.

sections.heading: Things You Need to File Form 8

points: Statement of Account and Solvency
Audited financial statements (if needed)
Details of the LLP Agreement
Digital signatures of designated partners

sections.heading: Why It's Important to File Form 8

points: Required every year for LLPs
Keeps MCA happy
Avoids fines and legal notices
Necessary for loans, GST, or business credibility

list.title: Does an LLP with no business have to fill out Form 8?
points: Yes. Even if they don't make any money, all LLPs have to file Form 8 every year.

list.title: Can you file Form 8 online?
points: Yes. You can send Form 8 electronically through the MCA portal using the partner DSC.

list.title: What happens if you don't file Form 8?
points: If you file late, you'll have to pay a fine every day, and LLP may be marked as non-compliant, which could lead to legal action.

list.title: Do you need to do an audit to file Form 8?
points: Yes, if the LLP's turnover is more than ₹40 lakh or its contribution is more than ₹25 lakh, as the LLP Act says.
